#Backend TestThe goal of this test is to create a middleware API that is able to handle a HTTP request from a client and fetch the appropriate resource from a backend. The backend is located in : `https://api.dev.elucidate.co/`The documentation to this api is in: `https://api.dev.elucidate.co/docs`To access this api you need the a token like:```Bearer eyJhbGciOiJSUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCIsImtpZCI6Ik0wVTRPRE14T1VORVJUWTBOekZFUWtReE1USkNRVE5GUVVZd01ETkNOVVpFTjBNMVJEY3dNUSJ9..b5qjyFtN0194LgBW5hGOlLzborsSCZI_2lx-JWMzjpx9MmEUlxXWy_wSpnhhRYg2ZQEblXtPErnZvOYigM16qOTaqODXYP3-iEp5sISHOmnAgKMCoU6Tsk_aDKeoQ2-Lb140Z79H7Lo_FkVgWh-Hiv6M-msVj8Pdl-YWRSYniYFucH36rhION80aJWO42dHRdL4iAkh6BZsqadJs7UxwWJVZOeKtI5Zug8EuktjssSvlTbfC87mBrATydX6LxW1iVmCnf9UGrpkaOtovrpgO3vR2-GbID6kD46xzG3CZWYEPYeKB4vLa3aXrlsp7BOEZCTpfPnhgDzcD1JC5GDDa9Q```When needed this token can also be obtained from authenticating in auth0 on: `https://efi.dev.elucidate.co/login`With the username:```take a look in the .env file ```## The goal ### Searchto query the proxy-API with a string and check in the backend if that string exists as an institution on ```curl -X GET "https://api.dev.elucidate.co/institutions?fullSearch=XXX" -H  "accept: application/ld+json" -H  "Authorization: Bearer Token"```If the string exists return ```Status - code 200 Body - Amount of results ```handle any possible failures ### reportIf the string doesn’t exist, create a ticket resource with information that the institution doesn’t exists Example: ```curl -X POST "https://api.dev.elucidate.co/tickets" -H  "accept: application/ld+json" -H  "Authorization: Bearer Token" -H  "Content-Type: application/ld+json" -d "{  \"project\": \"projects/2a9caad1-19c7-4340-949f-30b81a8a043e\",         \"title\": \"missing Institution X\",         \"description\": \"add Institution X \",         \"createdAt\": \"2020-02-31T14:36:04.481Z\",         \"updatedAt\": \"2020-02-31T14:36:04.481Z\"    }"```## Return your resultsDevelop the tasks in PHP or Python with any framework you want. Include information on how to ship the results and add proper tests.Document your findings and problems in a Readme.Submit the results as soon as you have finished and let us know the time you needed.
